intro: Barleria bolusii, commonly known as the Bolus barleria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in well-drained soils. It has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. Barleria bolusii is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively drought-tolerant.
